support_summary: TFEB interacts with β-catenin (CTNNB1) and TCF/LEF1 transcription factors in the nucleus to co-activate a specific subset of Wnt target genes. This links TFEB's function to the canonical Wnt signaling pathway, modulating the expression of genes distinct from its typical lysosomal and autophagy targets.

functions.cellular_process: Under active Wnt signaling, nuclear TFEB forms a transcriptional complex with β-catenin (CTNNB1) and TCF/LEF1. This complex binds to the promoters of a specific subset of Wnt-responsive genes, distinct from canonical TFEB target genes containing CLEAR elements.
functions.effect_description: TFEB acts as a transcriptional co-activator with β-catenin, driving the expression of a unique set of Wnt target genes and thereby integrating lysosomal signaling with Wnt pathway outputs.
biological_consequence: Active Wnt signaling promotes TFEB nuclear entry → Nuclear TFEB forms a complex with CTNNB1 (β-catenin) and TCF/LEF1 → TFEB-CTNNB1-TCF/LEF1 complex binds Wnt-responsive promoters → Co-activation of a specific subset of Wnt target genes
specific_effects: Acts as a co-activator for a subset of Wnt target genes.
Physically interacts with β-catenin and TCF/LEF1 in a complex.
Integrates lysosomal signaling with the Wnt developmental pathway.

evidence.paper_title: PARsylated transcription factor EB (TFEB) regulates the expression of a subset of Wnt target genes by forming a complex with β-catenin-TCF/LEF1
evidence.authors: Kim S, Song G, Lee T, Kim M, Kim J, Kwon H, Kim J, Jeong W, Lee U, Na C, Kang S, Kim W, Seong JK, Jho EH
evidence.relevant_quote: nuclear localized PARsylated TFEB forms a complex with β-catenin-TCF/LEF1 to induce the “TFEB mediated Wnt target genes”.

evidence.paper_title: Wnt/β-Catenin Signaling Axis Is Required for TFEB-Mediated Gastric Cancer Metastasis and Epithelial-Mesenchymal Transition
evidence.authors: Fan Y, Lu Y, Chen Y, He L, Zhao L, Liu S, Li D, Lu A, Zhang G, Xu Z
evidence.relevant_quote: TFEB could trigger the aggregation of β-catenin in nucleus and activate its transcription, as well as facilitate the expression of Wnt/β-catenin target genes and EMT-related markers...

functions.function: Modulation of Wnt Signaling in Cardiac Remodeling
functions.cellular_process: In the context of myocardial infarction, TFEB expression leads to an overall inhibition of the pro-fibrotic effects of the Wnt/β-catenin signaling pathway. While TFEB and β-catenin co-localize in the nucleus and form a complex, the resulting transcriptional output shifts the gene expression profile of β-catenin, leading to an anti-fibrotic outcome.
functions.effect_description: TFEB inhibits the pathological outcomes of Wnt/β-catenin signaling during cardiac fibrosis, thereby improving ventricular remodeling after myocardial infarction.
biological_consequence: Myocardial infarction induces TFEB expression → TFEB forms a nuclear complex with CTNNB1 (β-catenin) → TFEB-CTNNB1 complex shifts transcription from pro-fibrotic to anti-fibrotic genes → Expression of α-SMA and collagen I is reduced → Attenuation of cardiac fibrosis
specific_effects: Inhibits pro-fibrotic Wnt/β-catenin signaling in cardiac fibroblasts.
Reduces expression of α-SMA and collagen I.

evidence.paper_title: Transcription factor EB (TFEB) improves ventricular remodeling after myocardial infarction by inhibiting Wnt/β-catenin signaling pathway
evidence.authors: Liu C, Zhou D, Chen Z, Li L, Chen Z, Lin K, Chen W
evidence.relevant_quote: TFEB demonstrated potential in restraining fibrosis after MI by inhibiting the Wnt/β-catenin signaling pathway.

mechanism: Under active Wnt signaling, nuclear TFEB forms a transcriptional complex with β-catenin (CTNNB1) and; In the context of myocardial infarction, TFEB expression leads to an overall inhibition of the pro-f
effect: TFEB acts as a transcriptional co-activator with β-catenin, driving the expression of a unique set of Wnt target genes and thereby integrating lysosomal signaling with Wnt pathway outputs.; TFEB inhibits the pathological outcomes of Wnt/β-catenin signaling during cardiac fibrosis, thereby improving ventricular remodeling after myocardial infarction.
summary: TFEB regulates CTNNB1 to regulate wnt target gene co-activation and modulation of wnt signaling in cardiac remodeling, ultimately affecting co-activation of a specific subset of wnt target genes.
